p: Organizations such as the WHO, National Institutes for Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) and the US Centers for Disease Control (CDC) publish lists of emerging pathogens which may be viral, bacterial or rickettsial in nature. The WHO priority list contains viruses which have been prioritized as the most likely to cause epidemics and for which the WHO will establish a Blueprint programme for accelerated research and development (R&D) 13. The list published in February 2018 is shown in Table 1.
